instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01041 5v ub400 getting hot
threads.message:
working on a1990 that was working but had failed usb port, replaced the bad cd3215 (ub300) but had no power after, replaced ub400 still no power, chips i was using were bought online, figured maybe the was bad, so i pulled chips from donor board and reballed, 
anyhow after spending most of the day Sunday on it i have restored 5v to all ports with .45amps, but UB400 i getting hot,  both ub400 and ub300 have been replaced 4-5x  cant seem to figure this out, cant seem to locate short on any of the LDO lines or surrounding components, qb300/qb4000 u7000 and rom chip have also been replaced

threads.title: 820-01041 5v ub400 getting hot
threads.message:
First inspect for knocked off components.
Compare diode mode readings on LDO lines between all CD3215 chips.

threads.title: 820-01041 5v ub400 getting hot
threads.message:
pp3v3_upc_tb_ldo .0009 CB408
pp1v8_upc_tb_ldod .0013 CB405
seems UB400 might be shorted again, very strange  i have replaced chip 4 times, could something else be blowing the chips after replacing

replaced CB400 again, ldo readings are normal again back to  5v .28amp
pp3v3_upc_tb_ldo .470 CB408
pp1v8_upc_tb_ldod .516 CB405
ppv1v1_upc_tb_ldo_bmc .516 CB404

these ldos seem a bit low compared to working board but not shorted 
c3208 .347
r3208 .347
r3209 .347

threads.title: 820-01041 5v ub400 getting hot
threads.message:
Do you get 1V1 LDO on the powered port?
Check on each CD3215 chip.

threads.title: 820-01041 5v ub400 getting hot
threads.message: yea pp1v1_upc_tb_ldo_bmc is present on all 4 ports. was missing on u3100, replaced chip and restored 1v1 ldo but still no power, 5.14v .26amp on all ports

threads.title: 820-01041 5v ub400 getting hot
threads.message:
If the board was working before, I can only suspect bad chips, bad solders, or broken trace.
Considering you've discarded knocked off components.
